subSections.title: Readings
Usage notes
subSections.text: * Both {{ja-l|汐}} and {{ja-l|潮}} have the kun-readings of ''shio'' and ''ushio''. Archaically, {{ja-r|夕汐|ゆうしお}} was used to mean tides during the night, and {{ja-r|朝潮|あさしお}} was used for tides in the morning. For tides at any time of day, the compound ''chōseki'' may be used, below.
